summary: This document is a list of exhibits for Chapter 2 of a report, likely from the U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG). It enumerates 41 exhibits, including legal filings, prison records, and policy documents related to the incarceration and death of Jeffrey Epstein, and the subsequent indictment and prosecution of two Bureau of Prisons correctional officers.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure of the case; listed as the subject of a BOP psychological reconstruction and a federal indictment. He was an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: A Bureau of Prisons correctional officer at MCC New York who was indicted and later entered into a deferred prosecution agreement related to the events surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: A Bureau of Prisons correctional officer at MCC New York who was indicted and later entered into a deferred prosecution agreement related to the events surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death.

connections.description: Both were correctional officers at MCC New York indicted together on the same charges (November 19, 2019) and subject to joint legal proceedings, including a nolle prosequi filing.

Noel was a correctional officer at the facility where Epstein was held. The exhibit list includes documents (check sheets, post orders) detailing the monitoring duties she and others were required to perform.

Thomas was a correctional officer at the facility where Epstein was held. The exhibit list includes documents (check sheets, post orders) detailing the monitoring duties he and others were required to perform.

events.title: Decision to Remand Epstein

events.title: SHU Check Sheet (Night Before Death)
events.description: A 30-minute check sheet for the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York, dated the night before Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: SHU Check Sheet (Morning of Death)
events.description: A 30-minute check sheet for the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York, dated the morning Jeffrey Epstein was found dead.

events.title: Indictment of Correctional Officers
events.description: An indictment was filed against correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Deferred Prosecution Agreements
events.description: Deferred prosecution agreements were filed for both Tova Noel and Michael Thomas.

events.title: Nolle Prosequi for Officers
events.description: A nolle prosequi (declination to prosecute) was filed for Tova Noel and Michael Thomas.

keyFacts: The document is an exhibit list for a DOJ OIG report, cataloging evidence related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death.
It includes key prison records from the days surrounding Epstein's death: daily assignment rosters and 30-minute check sheets for the Special Housing Unit on August 9 and 10, 2019.

It details the legal trajectory of two correctional officers, Tova Noel and Michael Thomas, showing their indictment in November 2019, deferred prosecution agreements in May 2021, and a nolle prosequi in January 2022.
The list references a BOP Psychological Reconstruction of Jeffrey Epstein dated September 17, 2019, conducted after his death.
Numerous BOP program statements and federal regulations are listed, indicating the investigation focused on compliance with prison policies and standards of conduct.
